alternative_title: How to send your Self Assessment tax return online
overview: Your options if you want to file your Self Assessment tax return online, including HMRC's free online service and commercial software you can buy
title: How to send your Self Assessment tax return online

table.body:
To send your Self Assessment tax return online, you can either:

- use HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC's) free Self Assessment Online service
- buy commercially available software

##What you need

You must have both:

- a 10-digit unique taxpayer reference - you get this when you [register for Self Assessment](/register-for-self-assessment "How to register for Self Assessment")
- an online account with HMRC or the [Government Gateway](/government-gateway "Government Gateway")

##If you already have an online account

You can use your user name and password to either:

- log in to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) [online services](https://online.hmrc.gov.uk/self-assessment/ "Log in to use Self Assessment online"){:rel="external"} 
- send your return using [software you can buy](software-you-can-buy "Commercial software for Self Assessment tax returns")


*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You can set up an online account through HM Revenue & Customs' online services. 

You'll need your:

- National Insurance number
- postcode
- Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) number

Sign up [as an organisation](https://online.hmrc.gov.uk/registration/organisation "Sign up for HMRC's online services for Self Assessment"){:rel="external"} if you're:

- a self-employed sole trader
- a business partnership
- a partner in a business partnership
- managing a trust

Sign up [as an individual](https://online.hmrc.gov.uk/registration/individual "Sign up for HMRC's online services for Self Assessment for your personal tax"){:rel="external"} if you're

- a director of a limited company
- filling in a Self Assessment tax return for any other reason

^ It takes 7 working days to set up an online account because HMRC has to post you an 'activation code' - you need this to 'activate' your account. ^

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Sign up for an online account

table.body:
Most people can fill in and send the individual Self Assessment tax return, including sections covering:

- employment
- self-employment
- income you get as a partner in a business partnership
- UK property income
- capital gains
- foreign income

##What you can't send 

You can't send a:

- Partnership tax return 
- Trust and Estate tax return
- Self Assessment tax return if you get income from a trust, you're a religious minister or need to fill in the Non-residence part of the return

^You can send these online if you [buy software.](/software-you-can-buy "Commercial software to send your Self Assessment tax return") ^

You can also fill in and send them [on paper.](/self-assessment-forms-and-helpsheets "Self Assessment return forms and helpsheets") 

##How the free online service works

You can see a demonstration on the [HM Revenue & Customs website.](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/demo/individual/self-assessment/index.html "Demonstration of HMRC's online service for Self Assessment"){:rel="external"}
table.title: Use the free Self Assessment Online service
